org.rdkit.knime.headers

Class AdditionalHeaderInfoRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ColumnHeaderRenderer
      • org.rdkit.knime.headers.AdditionalHeaderInfoRenderer

  • public class AdditionalHeaderInfoRenderer
extends ColumnHeaderRenderer
    This extension of the normal column header renderer is capable of rendering also additional information of column headers.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

      • createTextIcon

        protected javax.swing.Icon createTextIcon(int xCoord,
                                          int yCoord,
                                          int width,
                                          int height)
        Creates an icon that shows the text that the renderer currently uses. This is necessary because the normal label the master renderer is based on cannot be us for rendering the text as it is fully used to show an icon representation.
        Parameters:
        x - Coordinate x for rendering.
        y - Coordinate y for rendering.
        width - Width of the rendering area.
        height - Height of the rendering area.
        Returns:
        Icon capable of rendering the header text.

      • createIconWrapper

        protected javax.swing.Icon createIconWrapper(javax.swing.JTable table,
                                             int column,
                                             int width,
                                             int height,
                                             HeaderPropertyHandler handler,
                                             DataColumnSpec colSpec)
        Creates an icon instance based on painting logic that the renderer of the additional header information (see #getRenderer() provides.
        Parameters:
        table - Table subject of rendering. Must not be null.
        column - Column index in focus of rendering.
        width - Width of the space that can be filled out with the additional header information.
        height - Height of the space that can be filled out with the additional header information.
        Returns:
        Icon wrapper with capability to paint the additional header information. If no information is available or no renderer was found, it returns null.

      • changeColor

        protected java.awt.Color changeColor(java.awt.Color color,
                                     int difference)
        Takes the specified color and makes it darker or lighter according to the specified difference.
        Parameters:
        color - Original color to be changed. Can be null.
        difference - Difference to be applied to the red, green and blue values of the original color.
        Returns:
        New color object build from the original color and the specified differences. Returns null, if the passed in color was null.
